element.name: Description
element.value: Champion Winter Beer of Britain 2013. Rich, complex and dark porter, with an old port nose and coffee and bitter chocolate flavours on the palate. A 2013 Suggestabeer from Daryl Jenkins.

element.name: Description
element.value: Creamy pale ale infused with elderflowers picked on a local organic farm.

element.name: Description
element.value: Made using only the choicest US hops, this triple-hopped APA has a pleasant citrus fruit aroma and characteristic robust bitterness.

element.name: Description
element.value: Delicious floral bitter with a light fruity note and a hint of toasty maltiness.

element.name: Description
element.value: Classic roasted flavours along with a hint of sweetness. Warrior hops along with fine aroma hops create fruit and spice flavours.

element.name: Description
element.value: Cool, crisp and refreshing Kolsch-style lager.

element.name: Description
element.value: Extra strong export stout. Smooth, rich and fruity with roasted coffee and vanilla flavours.

element.name: Description
element.value: Pale beer with a hint of banoffee pie! So look out for the bananas and toffee.

element.name: Description
element.value: Strong willed, full bodied dark porter. Dark mahogany brown, lush aromas of toffee, treacle, Mocha coffee, vinous fruit. More complexity on the palate. Bittersweet finish, rich but not cloying.

element.name: Description
element.value: Light golden beer made with local wildflower honey.

element.name: Description
element.value: Big hoppy IPA, packed full of Kiwi hops with hints of honey and nectar. Tropical citrus and floral notes.

element.name: Description
element.value: Bright golden ale; a blend of pale malt, Cascade and Bobek hops with a late infusion of fresh elderflowers and lemon zest.

element.name: Description
element.value: Premium ale dominated by elaborate fruity hop notes, with grainy background and dry finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Smooth sweet stout, full of complex malty flavours.

element.name: Description
element.value: Dark ruby ale with rich, creamy head. Aromas of dark chocolate, coffee and burnt toast. Lingering bitter finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Tasty dark stout with rich nut and hop prickle and dry chocolate finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Deep, dark and intriguing mild, full bodied fruity flavour.

element.name: Description
element.value: Dark and smooth with an impressive full roast flavour that belies its strength.

element.name: Description
element.value: Platinum blonde bitter, citrus and pine nose with dry, crisp and hoppy taste.

element.name: Description
element.value: Easy drinking summer ale (more to follow)

element.name: Description
element.value: Auburn chestnut beer, grassy aroma of autumn fruit with sweet then dry taste. A 2013 Suggestabeer from Andrew Parry.

element.name: Description
element.value: Complex, dark, full flavoured traditional mild. Strong malt and roast flavours lead to a long satisfying finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: A surge of pine engulfs the palate while hints of orange and watermelon cascade across a dry and bitter landscape. Long finish, defined with a hint of sweetness.

element.name: Description
element.value: Single hop pale strong bitter with aromatic notes of pear, lemon and lime. The poweful hops are tempered by the sweetness of 10% maize.

element.name: Description
element.value: The original dry Titanic stout comboned with the flavours of warm, enveloping smooth cappuccino.

element.name: Description
element.value: Red copper coloured. Nutty and malty aromas with some lemon and raisins. Chocolate malt and melon to taste.

element.name: Description
element.value: Light blonde Belgian style fruit beer with essence of cherries. Dry, hoppy and refreshing at the finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Classic English ale, given an American twist. Complex malt character, medium bodied and moderate levels of bitterness.

element.name: Description
element.value: Session ale with malt and biscuit notes. Delicate hop aroma and refreshing cirtus hop aftertaste.

element.name: Description
element.value: Dark golden/copper. Fruity aroma with fruit to taste. Refreshing, bitter finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Ruby ale, good bitterness and a hint of fruit on the nose.

element.name: Description
element.value: Dark chocolate brown with some ruby. Intense roast followed by summer fruits to taste. Strong roast malt continues to the aftertaste.

element.name: Description
element.value: Dark ruby strong ale with a good balance of fruit and hops, leading to a pleasant, lingering hops and malt finish. A 2013 Suggestabeer from Wendy Jamieson-Price.

element.name: Description
element.value: Hoppy traditional India Pale Ale. Intense floral aroma with well balanced bitterness.

element.name: Description
element.value: Dark golden India pale ale. Pronounced New Zealand hop character and smooth biscuit base, offset by fruit aroma.

element.name: Description
element.value: Very pale ale, easily suppable, lingering but light mouthfeel.

element.name: Description
element.value: Light straw coloured ale, brewed with the herb meadowsweet.

element.name: Description
element.value: Robust porter with initial caramel and coffee notes overlaid with a hint of smoke. Lingering aftertaste leading to a dry finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: A continuously hopped 85 minute IPA brewed with copious amounts of American hops.

element.name: Description
element.value: Refreshing blonde ale delicately infused with the flavour of elderflower. A 2013 Suggestabeer from Angela Lea.

element.name: Description
element.value: Traditional best bitter with delicious malt notes and a subtle depth of hop character.

element.name: Description
element.value: Pale amber summer beer. Lovely grapefruit aroma with some spicy notes from three types of hop (Columbus, Chinook and Summit). Brewed to support the work of the Marine Conservation Society.

element.name: Description
element.value: Pale ale originally brewed for the Ludlow Festival.

element.name: Description
element.value: In the style of an India Pale Ale using Progress hops and Optic malt for an underlying cereal taste, leading to a clean and crisp finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Dark stout infused with root ginger.

element.name: Description
element.value: Full bodied copper beer displaying a delicate blend of cloves, coriander and heaps of fiery ginger.

element.name: Description
element.value: Delicate flavour with hint of ginger and rosemary. Maris Otter pale malt and Northdown hops.

element.name: Description
element.value: Hoppy golden ale, fused with Cornish honey, giving a superb round finish with a hint of ginger.

element.name: Description
element.value: Yellow/golden best bitter with a good balance of malt and fruity hop on the nose and the palate. The sweetness follows through an ultimately more bitter finish. A 2013 Suggestabeer from Viv and Martyn Clarke of Worcester.

element.name: Description
element.value: Refreshing golden ale made with a combination of English and American hops to create a smooth beer with slight taste of citrus.

element.name: Description
element.value: Golden beer with a fruity aroma and lasting bitter finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Combining British and continental malts to give a beer with good body, caramelised undertones and distinct gold colour.

element.name: Description
element.value: Golden in colour with fruit and malt on the nose, satisfying biscuit flavours and lasting malty aftertaste.

element.name: Description
element.value: Golden ale hopped with Citra, Calypso and Centennial hops to create an intensely fresh hoppy aroma.

element.name: Description
element.value: Brewed with three varieties of New Zealand hops. Light coloured, 'pacifically' hoppy and bitter.

element.name: Description
element.value: Dark ruby beer, a cross between a dark mild and a brown ale using four different types of malt to bring out toffee, chocolate and spicy flavours.

element.name: Description
element.value: Light amber , fruity ale brewed with Bramling Cross and Challenger hops.

element.name: Description
element.value: Pale gold packing a hop punch.

element.name: Description
element.value: Smooth dark red porter with German malts and hops. Additions of fresh ground coffee and roast hazelnut syrup give depth and complexity.

element.name: Description
element.value: Malt fruit sweet flavour giving way to a long bittersweet aftertaste.

element.name: Description
element.value: Amber ale, brewed with Endeavour hops and honey. Subtle sweetness and spice.

element.name: Description
element.value: Fresh, piercing palate, with soft malt overtones and pronounced citrus flavours. Lemon and grapefruit on the finish. A 2013 Suggestabeer from David Scott.

element.name: Description
element.value: Beautifully red hued, smooth drinking ale with fruit and berry aromas. Brewed with Hibiscus flowers.

element.name: Description
element.value: A new cask conditioned lager brewed using German hops to give a crisp, herbal taste and aroma.

element.name: Description
element.value: Traditional strong and hoppy Indian pale ale, brewed with Maris Otter pale ale malt.

element.name: Description
element.value: Dark chestnut ale. Perfect balance of malty nuttiness and a fresh hoppy aroma.

element.name: Description
element.value: Golden full bodied ale with undertones of grapefruit and a long lasting citrus, hoppy aftertaste.

element.name: Description
element.value: Complex, well-balanced IPA with a lovely blend of citrus and fruit flavours mixed with a slight sweetness and ending with a lingering, bitter finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Very pale yellow beer. Fruit dominates throughout including notes of kiwi fruit, grapefruit and lychees. Dry palate, zesty finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Rich, nut brown Yorkshire ale, infused with US hops.

element.name: Description
element.value: American style pale ale bursting with hoppy flavour and belying its low alcohol content.

element.name: Description
element.value: Pale refreshing beer. Smooth tasting. Very quaffable.

element.name: Description
element.value: Amber coloured bitter, merging biscuity sweetness of English malt with fruity, floral bitterness of Kentish hops. Toffee and spice in the nose, dry taste.

element.name: Description
element.value: Pale golden ale with interesting blend of internationally sourced hops to give a refreshing, crisp light flavour.

element.name: Description
element.value: No description available. A 2013 Suggestabeer from Jack Brown.

element.name: Description
element.value: Pale summer beer with a hint of strawberry.

element.name: Description
element.value: Crisp pale ale, made using Green Bullet hops from New Zealand for a distinctive herby, floral note.

element.name: Description
element.value: Honey from The Norfolk Lavender Company is added during the brewing process to give this beer a delicate yet moreish flavour.

element.name: Description
element.value: Pale bitter combining lager and traditional ale malts with English grown Cascade and Pilgrim hops. The result is a fruity aroma, slightly zesty flavour but still with some malt.

element.name: Description
element.value: Malt is complemented by the citrus hop character in this well-balanced best bitter with a dry, bitter aftertaste that grows on drinking. Develops pleasant caramelised peel notes as beer ages. A 2013 Suggestabeer from Jack the Ladd.

element.name: Description
element.value: Light coloured golden ale with distinctive hoppy aroma and crisp clean bitterness on the finish. Smooth, light and refreshing.

element.name: Description
element.value: Refreshing pale summer ale from blend of American hops.

element.name: Description
element.value: Traditional old style Welsh ale with a combination of crystal, black and chocolate malts.

element.name: Description
element.value: Staffordshire Mara Villa raspberries are added late in the brewing process to give a subtle raspberry edge.

element.name: Description
element.value: A unique blend of Herefordshire hops, including Fuggles and the trial hop Minstrel. Delicious golden ale with sweeter malt flavours, leading to a dry, moreish finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Classic mild; complex layers of taste come from roasted malt that predominate and give lots of flavour.

element.name: Description
element.value: Dark stout. Sweet at first with a smoky bitter finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Honey golden beer, delighting the palate with initial sweetness that fades rapidly to let powerful citrus hops take over.

element.name: Description
element.value: Wheat beer spiced with roasted orange peel, cloves and coriander.

element.name: Description
element.value: Golden in colour, tangy clean bitterness, strong hoppy taste.

element.name: Description
element.value: Chocolate, coffee, roast malt and hops with lots of body and dark fruits. Complex, rich beer, dark brown in colour.

element.name: Description
element.value: Mellow, nutty, moreish dark mild. Champion Beer of Britain 2011.

element.name: Description
element.value: Straw coloured ale brewed with Maris Otter pale malt and finest British hops. Some honey in the aroma with grapefruit and elderflower in the taste.

element.name: Description
element.value: Top fermented lager flavoured with Czech Saaz hops.

element.name: Description
element.value: Light, refreshing, pale gold beer with crisp citrus notes, this satisfying brew is perfect for lazy summer evenings.

element.name: Description
element.value: Refreshing hoppy ale ith citrus and tropical notes. Low ABV but big body.

element.name: Description
element.value: Pure golden ale. Taste full of malt biscuit with ripe peach and pear fruit overtones.

element.name: Description
element.value: Continental style fruit beer, Mouth filling fruit, with zingy finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Golden, fruity all American full bodied taste.

element.name: Description
element.value: Rich yet smooth mild with chocolate overtones.

element.name: Description
element.value: Golden brown with balanced bitterness and a fresh grapefruit nose.

element.name: Description
element.value: Ruby coloured ale made with pale malt, crystal malt, wheat malt and roasted barley. Somewhat nutty yet sweet taste.

element.name: Description
element.value: Chestnut brown premium ale. Rich fruit and spice on the nose; fruity, dry finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: A Scottish cask lager, brewed using a lager yeast and Hersbrucker hops. A hoppy aroma, with fruit and malt, leads to a malty, bitter taste with floral hoppiness and a bitter finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: The aroma is of fruit and hops, leading to a rich, malty, creamy taste balanced by hops. An initial burst of sweetness is followed by an increasing bitterness on the tongue. A 2013 Suggestabeer from Nigel Heywood.

element.name: Description
element.value: Golden well rounded bitter with Admiral hops.

element.name: Description
element.value: Mellow easy drinking ale brewed with a little crystal malt and a lot of Goldings hops. Some malt in the body.

element.name: Description
element.value: Aromatic IPA, deep gold in colour with aromas of elderflower and citrus hops, followed by sweet caramel. Lingering floral aftertaste.

element.name: Description
element.value: Exceptionally light, hoppy drinkability. Clean, fresh bitterness and gorgeous, zesty hop flavour.

element.name: Description
element.value: Light ale, crisp and full of citrus flavours. A 2013 Suggestabeer from John Bloomfield.

element.name: Description
element.value: Refreshing blonde beer made with Challenger, Brambling Cross and Cascade English hops.

element.name: Description
element.value: Delicate straw coloured ale. Subtle blend of fruit and spice flavours with citrus overtones.

element.name: Description
element.value: Light ale, slight dry bitterness with a hint of vanilla.

element.name: Description
element.value: Made with the hedgerow Endeavour hop from Herefordshire, imparting a familiar English bitterness with subtle dark fruit and citrus in the background. A 2013 Suggestabeer from David Scott. (Well, sort of, David actually wanted Amarillo but that's not the current single hop beer!)

element.name: Description
element.value: Unique flavoured red ale, lightly hopped with American Galena and Cluster hops. Smooth drinking with soft fruity finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Light blueberry flavours offset the citrus finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Made with 100% Australian hops, heady aromas and pronounced flavours of melon, passion fruit, citrus and white peach.

element.name: Description
element.value: Honey gold complexion, citrus floral aroma, unusual use of Sladek lagering hops.

element.name: Description
element.value: Pale and hoppy cask pilsner. Fresh citrus hop finish and pleasant malt backbone.

element.name: Description
element.value: Velvety stout with a wonderful rich dark colour. Subtle bitterness giving way to late sweetness and underlying roast barley hints.

element.name: Description
element.value: Straw coloured ale with mouth filling malt, complemented by a lovely tropical fruitness on the nose and palate, Long refreshing finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Pale summer ale, floral, dry and hoppy brewed with hand picked elderflowers from the hedgreows of Norfolk and Suffolk.

element.name: Description
element.value: Blonde/golden straw summer ale. Aroma of ginger, lime and spice. Light refreshing flavour.

element.name: Description
element.value: Light and hoppy seasonal beer, brewed with Bramling Cross hops from the UK and Chinook hops from the US. Spicy aroma, malty yet dry finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Rich deep golden ale with intense Magnum hop bitterness, finishing in a cascade of flowery grapefruit.

element.name: Description
element.value: Smooth malty and sweet on the palate, with a refreshing citrus kick and refined hoppy aftertaste. Straw coloured.

element.name: Description
element.value: Initial sweetness adds to fruitness and grapefruit tang of this summer ale withou detracting from its clean flavour and rich hop aroma.

element.name: Description
element.value: Golden, thirst quenching beer, packed with flavours of summer berries. Pleasant biscuit finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Hazy amber/blonde coloured ale. Light hops, moderate bitter finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: A clear wheat beer flavoured with Sorachi Ace hops, lime peel, lime leaf, lemongrass and galangal. Beer of the Festival at Worcester 2012.

element.name: Description
element.value: A massive citrus fruit, hop and elderflower nose leads to hints of grapefruit and apricot in the mouth. The exceptional bittersweetness in the taste lasts through the long, lingering aftertaste.

element.name: Description
element.value: Golden beer, blasting off with poweful grapefruit and citrus aromas and flavours, touching down with an intense and satisfying bitter finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Strong golden ale with bitter sweet taste. Dry hop finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Deep golden beer inspired by Iron Maiden! Malt flavours and citrus notes from Bobek, Goldings and Cascade hops with a subtle hint of lemon. A 2013 Suggestabeer from Sean Doona and Katie Walker.

element.name: Description
element.value: Well rounded porter with a hint of bitter chocolate and blackcurrant aroma.

element.name: Description
element.value: Golden amber ale. Grapefruit and cherries on the nose, smooth lasting bitterness to finish.

element.name: Description
element.value: Delicious blend of American hops with highlights of ginger.
